greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k >= 0 such that 5^k has exactly n 0's in its decimal representation.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3373
M. F. Hasler, Zeroless powers. OEIS Wiki, March 2014
maple: for k from 1 while count <= N do
if m <= N and A[m] < 0 then A[m]:= k; count:= count+1;
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 0; While[ Count[ IntegerDigits[5^k], 0] != n, k++ ]; a = Append[a, k], {n, 0, 50} ]; a
xref: Cf. A031146 (analog for 2^k), A063555 (analog for 3^k), A063575 (analog for 4^k), A063596 (analog for 6^k).
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 10 2001
ext: a(0) changed to 0 (as in A031146, A063555, ...) and better title from _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 14 2018
